subject: Personal Finance
title: Weimar Germany's Nightmare
description: A quick, practical guide to Weimar Germany's Nightmare.

hook.text: In 1923 Germany, a loaf of bread cost 200 billion marks. Workers were paid twice a day.

buildup.text: After WWI, Germany printed money to pay war reparations. The currency became worthless.

discovery.text: Prices doubled every few days. People burned banknotes for fuel because paper was cheaper than wood.

twist.text: The trauma scarred Germany forever. It's why the Bundesbank was obsessively anti-inflation for decades.

climax.text: The crisis ended only when Germany introduced a completely new currency backed by land.

punchline.text: Money can become cheaper than firewood.

quiz.question: Why did hyperinflation strike Weimar Germany?
options: The government printed money to pay war debts
